intro: Rhodiola sedoides, commonly known as the golden root or king's crown, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Rhodiola sedoides is known for its ability to withstand extreme temperatures and is often found in mountainous areas. It is also valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for centuries.
